taskbody.context: Use this procedure to start the service (serviced) on a master host after installing and configuring it. This procedure is valid for single-host and multi-host deployments, whether the deployment has internet access or not, and is only performed once.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .

step.info: To monitor progress, enter the following command: journalctl -flu serviced -o cat

stepresult.p: On hosts with internet access, the serviced daemon invokes docker to pull its internal services images from Docker Hub. The browser and command-line interfaces are unavailable until the images are installed and tagged, and the services are started. The process takes about 5 minutes.
On hosts without internet access, the serviced daemon tags images in the local registry and starts its internal services. The browser and command-line interfaces are unavailable for about 3 minutes.
When the message Host Master successfully started is displayed, is ready for the next procedure.

result.note: Until the master host is added to a pool, all serviced CLI commands that use the RPC server must be run as root.
